J C Lawrence <claw@kanga.nu> writes:
> Tom Reingold <noglider@pobox.com> wrote:
>> Years ago, there was a package called mh-e which was an emacs
>> interface to MH.  I don't know if it's still around or works.  But
>> it's an idea.

> Its still around, its actively maintained, and its quite well evolved.

I useta use mh-e regularly, but I never figured out whether it could
handle exmh's multidrop mechanism, which is something I've grown to
rely on.  Does that work in recent mh-e versions?  I'd love to use
mh-e when reading mail remotely, if it can handle my multiple-inbox-
folders setup...

			regards, tom lane
